content.description: Sit start with a pair of edges. From there, gain a right hand sloper, follow to a left hand edge, then reach a great right hand edge, apply a high foot, crank around the bulge, reach an edge at the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The landing has few rocks directly behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the center of Abalone's south face.

content.description: Stand start with a left hand incut edge and a right hand sidepull crimp. From there, slap up to a left hand sloper-sidepull, slap to a right hand sidepull block, set the feet, make a big move to a bump, get your right foot up, match hands, and finish up the remaining bumps and slopers.
content.protection: The landing has a tree and rock that border the fall zone. A pair of pads should cover it though.
content.location: It climbs the blunt south facing arete of Abalone.

content.description: Sit start with a right hand pinch and a left hand palming the arete with the microedges. From there, stick the elbow of the arete with the right hand, cross under to a left hand edge, float the feet over to the right (such a fun sequence!), gain the good flat jug, reach the lip, and mantle on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The immediate landing is great, but there is a rock that sits behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the northwest arete of Abalone.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on a diagonal crimp. From there, move out left to the good shelf, then reach the arete, follow it right until reaching the jug, throw a heel around, and top it out on the remaining slab.
content.protection: A pad or two will work. The landing is pretty good.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Abalone.
